pull.title: wallet: Require a start block in ScanForWalletTransactions
pull.body:
`ScanForWalletTransactions` incorrectly documents that `pindexStart` is optional. Fix that by making that parameter a const reference.

To the best of my knowledge it is impossible to hit those code paths from functional tests and I think it is not worth to write a unit test for this edge case:

```cpp
pindexStart == nullptr /* i.e. "optional" */ && pindexStop != nullptr

events.body:
Good find, but this is made redundant in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14711

EDIT: I see your comment there, fair enough if you want to clean this up before that PR goes in
I prefer getting this in before #14711
@MeshCollider While unlikely to be hit in practice, this is a bugfix and not fixed by the refactoring in #14711

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#14711](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/14711.html) (Remove uses of chainActive and mapBlockIndex in wallet code by ryanofsky)
* [#13076](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/13076.html) (Fix ScanForWalletTransactions to return an enum indicating scan result: success / failure / user_abort by Empact)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

FYI the associated test is passing for me on `master`:

```
$ python3 test/functional/wallet_rescan.py 
2018-11-13T19:05:22.673000Z TestFramework (INFO): Initializing test directory /var/folders/_v/0klckbk95bxgt21rhcj_6qb40000gn/T/testg2yddy4y
2018-11-13T19:05:23.510000Z TestFramework (INFO): Create wallet with timestamps in the future
2018-11-13T19:05:24.475000Z TestFramework (INFO): Mine some (current time) blocks to rescan
2018-11-13T19:05:25.079000Z TestFramework (INFO): Check that rescanning the wallet from future does not crash
2018-11-13T19:05:25.831000Z TestFramework (INFO): Stopping nodes
2018-11-13T19:05:26.211000Z TestFramework (INFO): Cleaning up /var/folders/_v/0klckbk95bxgt21rhcj_6qb40000gn/T/testg2yddy4y on exit
2018-11-13T19:05:26.211000Z TestFramework (INFO): Tests successful
```

rename.from: wallet: Fix crash when rescanning wallet from future
rename.to: wallet: Fix rescan of wallets from the future

verification.payload:
tree ddec7e718fce3ad2b29debf73f51d040802917da
parent cbf00939b5e813937fb21466aa3e229ca81cb6ba
author MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1542060662 -0500

wallet: Require a start block in ScanForWalletTransactions

events.message: wallet: Require a start block in ScanForWalletTransactions

events.body: @Empact My bad. Indeed, the test only crashed on my machine because I added further asserts locally. To the best of my knowledge it is impossible to hit those code paths from functional tests and I think it is not worth to write a unit test for this edge case: Start block == nullptr && end block != nullptr.
On a second look @MeshCollider is correct. This is also fixed in  #14711, so please review that instead.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,36 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2018 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+
+import time
+
+from test_framework.test_framework import BitcoinTestFramework
+
+
+class WalletRescanTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
+    def set_test_params(self):
+        self.num_nodes = 1
+        self.setup_clean_chain = True
+
+    def skip_test_if_missing_module(self):
+        self.skip_if_no_wallet()
+
+    def setup_nodes(self):
+        self.add_nodes(self.num_nodes)
+        self.start_nodes()
+
+    def run_test(self):
+        self.log.info("Create wallet with timestamps in the future")
+        self.restart_node(0, extra_args=["-mocktime={}".format(int(time.time() + 24 * 60 * 60)), "-wallet=from_future"])
+
+        self.log.info("Mine some (current time) blocks to rescan")
+        self.restart_node(0)
+        self.nodes[0].generate(10)
+
+        self.log.info("Check that rescaning the wallet from future does not crash")

comments.body: `Genesis` can return `nullptr` - maybe throw on that above rather than possibly get a null dereference error?
